analyzed: @342a / /'phags pa zla ba'i snying pos zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Sūtra Requested by Candragarbha

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i tshul lung bstan pa /
translated: predicts the way the Buddha’s teaching will remain and disappear.

analyzed: sngon sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa ri kha rhi thag gi steng na bzhugs te /
translated: In the past, the blessed Buddha Śākyamuni was dwelling on the summit of Mount Kharī.

original: de'i tshe phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khor @342b dang bcas pa dang / dgra bcom pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khor @342b dang bcas pa dang / dgra bcom pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas of the ten directions, together with their retinues, the arhats, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, kinnaras, mahoragas,

original: nam mkha' lding dang / bdud sdig can la sogs pa mthu bo che thams cad tshogs pa de'i dus na /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding dang / bdud sdig can la sogs pa mthu bo che thams cad tshogs pa de'i dus na /
translated: garuḍas, and all the powerful ones such as the evil Māra had gathered.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i zhal gyi smin mtshams nas 'od zer shar gyi lus 'phags dang / lho'i 'dzam bu gling dang / nub kyi ban glang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / gling 'di bzhir 'od zer kun du khyab par bkram ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i zhal gyi smin mtshams nas 'od zer shar gyi lus 'phags dang / lho'i 'dzam bu gling dang / nub kyi ban glang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / gling 'di bzhir 'od zer kun du khyab par bkram ste /
translated: From the space between the eyebrows of the Buddha, the Bhagavan Shakyamuni, light rays spread out to the eastern continent of Videha, to the southern continent of Jambudvipa, to the western continent of Godaniya, to the northern continent of Kuru, and to all four continents.

original: 'od zer btang ba de'i tshe ri rab la sogs pa ri chen po dang / ri dang / nags tshal dang / sman ljongs /
analyzed: 'od zer btang ba de'i tshe ri rab la sogs pa ri chen po dang / ri dang / nags tshal dang / sman ljongs /
translated: When the light rays were emitted, the great mountains such as Mount Meru, the mountains, the forests, the medicinal trees,

original: ri sul / grags grog kun la'ang snang bar mnyam ste /
analyzed: ri sul / grags grog kun la'ang snang bar mnyam ste /
translated: the mountain valleys, and the ravines were all illuminated equally.

original: lag mthil dang 'dra bar gling bzhi car snang bas gsal bar gyur /
analyzed: lag mthil dang 'dra bar gling bzhi car snang bas gsal bar gyur /
translated: The four continents were illuminated as if they were the palm of one's hand.

original: 'od zer de dag las sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs kha dog dang / dbyibs sna tshogs 'od dang bcas pa phal po che byung ba /
analyzed: 'od zer de dag las sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs kha dog dang / dbyibs sna tshogs 'od dang bcas pa phal po che byung ba /
translated: From those light rays, many buddha forms with various colors and shapes and light appeared.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha dang / klu la sogs pa sems can mang po kun gyis mthong sta ngo mtshar du gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / lha dang / klu la sogs pa sems can mang po kun gyis mthong sta ngo mtshar du gyur to //
translated: Many beings such as bodhisattvas, gods, nagas, and so forth saw them and were amazed.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la bee shra wa na la sogs pa rgyal po chen po bzhis gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la bee shra wa na la sogs pa rgyal po chen po bzhis gsol pa /
translated: Then the four great kings, Vaiśravaṇa and so forth, requested Bhagavān Śākyamuni,

original: 'od zer 'di lta bu de ci'i don du mdzad pa lags zhes zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'od zer 'di lta bu de ci'i don du mdzad pa lags zhes zhus pa las /
translated: “What is the purpose of this light?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu gling bzhir ngas gsungs pa'i dam @343a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu gling bzhir ngas gsungs pa'i dam @343a *//
translated: The Bhagavān replied,

original: pa'i chos kyi gsung rab dang / ring bsrel dang / gzugs brnyan 'di lta bu dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: pa'i chos kyi gsung rab dang / ring bsrel dang / gzugs brnyan 'di lta bu dag 'byung ste /
translated: “After I pass into nirvāṇa, these scriptures of the holy Dharma that I have taught, my relics, and images like this will appear in the four continents.

original: 'di khyed kyi lag tu gtad kyis srungs shig /
analyzed: 'di khyed kyi lag tu gtad kyis srungs shig /
translated: I entrust them to you. Protect them.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' zla ba'i snying pos gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' zla ba'i snying pos gsol pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Candragarbha requested the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: 'di lta bu'i thugs rje chen pos bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos rgyal po chen po dag la gtad pa shin tu ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i thugs rje chen pos bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos rgyal po chen po dag la gtad pa shin tu ngo mtshar to //
translated: it is most amazing that the Bhagavān, with such great compassion, has entrusted the holy Dharma after the Bhagavān’s nirvāṇa to the great kings.”

original: snga ma 'das pa'i sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas dgung lo bdun lags nas dam pa'i chos kyi gzugs brnyan nub na /
analyzed: snga ma 'das pa'i sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas dgung lo bdun lags nas dam pa'i chos kyi gzugs brnyan nub na /
translated: The Buddha said, In the past, after the Buddha had entered nirvana, when seven hundred years had passed and the image of the true Dharma had declined,

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos ji tsam gyi bar du gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos ji tsam gyi bar du gnas par 'gyur /
translated: how long will the true Dharma remain after the Bhagavān Śākyamuni enters nirvana?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa 'di lta bu'i chos zhus pa legs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa 'di lta bu'i chos zhus pa legs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavān said, It is excellent that you have asked about such a Dharma.

original: legs par nyon cig dang / ngas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par nyon cig dang / ngas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen well, and I will explain it to you.

original: nga mya ngan las 'das nas dam pa'i chos kyi gzugs brnyan lo nyis stong du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga mya ngan las 'das nas dam pa'i chos kyi gzugs brnyan lo nyis stong du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: After I enter nirvana, the image of the true Dharma will remain for two thousand years.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zla ba'i snying pos gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zla ba'i snying pos gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Candragarbha said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: dam pa'i chos 'di tha mar ji ltar nub par 'gyur /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'di tha mar ji ltar nub par 'gyur /
translated: how will this true Dharma decline in the end?

original: rgyu ci las nyams /
analyzed: rgyu ci las nyams /
translated: What are the causes of its decline?

original: sus ma mchis par bgyid /
analyzed: sus ma mchis par bgyid /
translated: Who will cause its disappearance?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu lo lnga brgya'i bar du nga'i bstan pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnam par grol ba mang du 'gyur @343b ro; ;de nas lo lnga brgya'i bar du ting nge 'dzin la spyod pa mang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu lo lnga brgya'i bar du nga'i bstan pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnam par grol ba mang du 'gyur @343b ro; ;de nas lo lnga brgya'i bar du ting nge 'dzin la spyod pa mang du 'gyur ro //
translated: “After my nirvāṇa, for five hundred years, there will be many sentient beings who practice my teachings and attain liberation. Then, for five hundred years, there will be many who practice samādhi.

original: rgyal po dang / blon po dang / sems can phal rnams kyang dam pa'i chos la dad cing spyod pa'ang phyir zhing nyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po dang / blon po dang / sems can phal rnams kyang dam pa'i chos la dad cing spyod pa'ang phyir zhing nyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Kings, ministers, and ordinary sentient beings will have faith in the true Dharma, but those who practice it will be few.

original: de nas lo lnga brgya'i bar du dam pa'i chos ston cing sems can 'dren pa dang / thar bar byed pa'i slob dpon mang du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas lo lnga brgya'i bar du dam pa'i chos ston cing sems can 'dren pa dang / thar bar byed pa'i slob dpon mang du 'byung ngo //
translated: Then, for five hundred years, there will be many masters who teach the true Dharma and lead and liberate sentient beings.

original: nyan thos dgra bcom pa ni nyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dgra bcom pa ni nyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Arhat śrāvakas will be few.

original: rgyal po dang / blon po dang / sems can phal rnams kyang nyan pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / blon po dang / sems can phal rnams kyang nyan pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Kings, ministers, and ordinary sentient beings will merely listen.

original: nyams su len cing spyod pa'am /
analyzed: nyams su len cing spyod pa'am /
translated: They will not practice or engage in it.

original: brtson 'grus ni mi byed de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni mi byed de /
translated: They will not be diligent.

original: dad pa 'bri bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pa 'bri bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Their faith will diminish.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi srungs ma rnams kyang mi dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi srungs ma rnams kyang mi dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: The guardians of the true Dharma will be unhappy.

original: dam pa'i chos la ma dad pa'i sems can rnams ni sngon pas mthu stobs skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la ma dad pa'i sems can rnams ni sngon pas mthu stobs skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sentient beings who have no faith in the true Dharma will become more powerful than before.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi'i rgyal po rnams kyang phan tshun gcig la gcig dmag 'dren cing 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi'i rgyal po rnams kyang phan tshun gcig la gcig dmag 'dren cing 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The kings of the humans of Jambudvīpa will wage war against each other.

original: bdud kyi ris kyang 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyang 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The class of māras will increase.

original: de nas yang lo lnga brgya'i tshe lo sum brgyar ni dam pa'i chos la gnas pa'i lha klu la sogs pa sems can srungs ma rnams mi gnas shing dam pa'i chos gang du dar bar 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de nas yang lo lnga brgya'i tshe lo sum brgyar ni dam pa'i chos la gnas pa'i lha klu la sogs pa sems can srungs ma rnams mi gnas shing dam pa'i chos gang du dar bar 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: Then, in five hundred years, for three hundred years, the gods, nāgas, and other sentient beings who are guardians of the true Dharma will not remain and will go wherever the true Dharma spreads.🔽Sentient beings will have no faith in the Dharma.

original: sems can chos la ma dad par 'gyur; sems can chos spyod pa rnams kyang chos kyi gzhung bzhin mi spyod /
analyzed: sems can chos la ma dad par 'gyur; sems can chos spyod pa rnams kyang chos kyi gzhung bzhin mi spyod /
translated: Even those sentient beings who practice the Dharma will not practice in accordance with the scriptures of the Dharma.

original: brtson 'grus chung bas grub pa nyung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chung bas grub pa nyung bar 'gyur /
translated: Because of their little diligence, their accomplishments will be few.

original: kha dog bzhi dang / bzhi las gyur pa'ang 'bri /
analyzed: kha dog bzhi dang / bzhi las gyur pa'ang 'bri /
translated: The four colors and those derived from the four will diminish.

original: @344a *// dri dang / ro la sogs pa'ang chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @344a *// dri dang / ro la sogs pa'ang chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: smells, tastes, and so forth will diminish.

original: mi nad dang / phyugs nad dang / mu ge'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi nad dang / phyugs nad dang / mu ge'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: There will be epidemics among humans and livestock, and famines will occur.

original: lo nyis brgyar ni dge slong yang chos bzhin mi spyod /
analyzed: lo nyis brgyar ni dge slong yang chos bzhin mi spyod /
translated: For two hundred years, monks will not practice the Dharma properly.

original: 'jig rten gyi khe dang / grags pa tshol /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khe dang / grags pa tshol /
translated: They will seek worldly profit and fame.

original: snying rje chung zhing khrims la mi gnas /
analyzed: snying rje chung zhing khrims la mi gnas /
translated: They will have little compassion and will not keep the rules.

original: dam pa'i chos tshul bzhin spyod pa rnams la ni glan ka tshol zhing skur pa 'debs /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos tshul bzhin spyod pa rnams la ni glan ka tshol zhing skur pa 'debs /
translated: They will look for faults in those who practice the holy Dharma properly and will slander them.

original: longs spyod dang / yo byad 'phrog /
analyzed: longs spyod dang / yo byad 'phrog /
translated: They will steal their possessions and goods.

original: 'jig rten gyi rgyal po'i gsang la rten cing rgyal srid 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rgyal po'i gsang la rten cing rgyal srid 'dzin /
translated: They will rely on the king’s secrets and hold political power.

original: rgyal po'i phrin pa'i pho nyar ngo 'phral tshol zhing 'gro /
analyzed: rgyal po'i phrin pa'i pho nyar ngo 'phral tshol zhing 'gro /
translated: They will go about looking for opportunities to curry favor with the king’s messengers.

original: rgyal po dang / 'bangs srid 'khrugs pa'i dbyen byed /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / 'bangs srid 'khrugs pa'i dbyen byed /
translated: They will cause dissension between the king and his subjects.

original: nyo tshong dang / khe spogs byed thabs tshol /
analyzed: nyo tshong dang / khe spogs byed thabs tshol /
translated: They will seek out ways to trade and make a profit.

original: dam pa'i chos spyod pa'ang snying nas nyams su blangs te mi spyod kyi /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spyod pa'ang snying nas nyams su blangs te mi spyod kyi /
translated: Even those who practice the holy Dharma will not practice it from the heart.

original: phal cher kha gsag dang / 'phral gyi tshul 'chos pa'i ya ma bral byed de /
analyzed: phal cher kha gsag dang / 'phral gyi tshul 'chos pa'i ya ma bral byed de /
translated: For the most part, they will be free of flattery and hypocrisy.

original: de'i dus na chos la dga' ba'i lha klu thams cad kyis rgyal khams kyi dge slong 'di ltar spyod pa'i sa gzhi bor te mi gnas shing /
analyzed: de'i dus na chos la dga' ba'i lha klu thams cad kyis rgyal khams kyi dge slong 'di ltar spyod pa'i sa gzhi bor te mi gnas shing /
translated: At that time, all the gods and nagas who delight in the Dharma will abandon the land where the monks behave in this way and will not remain there.

original: bdud kyi ris la sogs pa chos kyi bgegs kyi ris rnams der 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris la sogs pa chos kyi bgegs kyi ris rnams der 'byung ste /
translated: The classes of demons and so forth, which are the classes of obstacles to the Dharma, will appear there.

original: mthu dang / stobs skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mthu dang / stobs skye bar 'gyur /
translated: They will increase their power and strength.

original: rgyal po dang / blon po la sogs pa dad pa 'bri /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / blon po la sogs pa dad pa 'bri /
translated: The faith of the kings, ministers, and so forth will diminish.

original: dge sdig gi dmigs mi phyed /
analyzed: dge sdig gi dmigs mi phyed /
translated: They will not distinguish between virtue and evil.

original: dam pa'i chos la rma 'byin /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la rma 'byin /
translated: They will wound the sublime Dharma.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor dang / dge 'dun gyi rdzas la spyod cing rku 'phrog byed @344b de sdig la mi 'dzem /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor dang / dge 'dun gyi rdzas la spyod cing rku 'phrog byed @344b de sdig la mi 'dzem /
translated: They will use the property of the Three Jewels and the property of the Sangha, and they will steal and plunder. They will not refrain from evil.

original: gzugs brnyan dang / mchod rten rnams khad kyis bshig /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang / mchod rten rnams khad kyis bshig /
translated: They will gradually destroy the images and stupas.

original: mchod pa'i yo byad phri /
analyzed: mchod pa'i yo byad phri /
translated: They will diminish the offerings.

original: de'i tshe dam pa'i chos ma nor bar spyod pa dge slong dang / khyim pa 'ga' 'ga' tsam gnas pa de'i bsod nams kyis yul phyogs su char chu dus su 'bab cing lo legs /
analyzed: de'i tshe dam pa'i chos ma nor bar spyod pa dge slong dang / khyim pa 'ga' 'ga' tsam gnas pa de'i bsod nams kyis yul phyogs su char chu dus su 'bab cing lo legs /
translated: By their merit, rain will fall in its season, the crops will be good,

original: mi rgyags la nad nyung zhing yul bde ba dag kyang bar 'ga' 'byung /
analyzed: mi rgyags la nad nyung zhing yul bde ba dag kyang bar 'ga' 'byung /
translated: the people will be well-fed, and there will be few illnesses and much happiness.

original: de lta bu mi gnas pa phal cher ni sdug bsngal mi bde ba sna tshogs 'byung /
analyzed: de lta bu mi gnas pa phal cher ni sdug bsngal mi bde ba sna tshogs 'byung /
translated: But for the most part, there will be no such things, and various sufferings and unhappiness will occur.

original: de'i dus su rgya gar dang / rgya ma yin pa'i rgyal po chen po gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i dus su rgya gar dang / rgya ma yin pa'i rgyal po chen po gsum 'byung ste /
translated: At that time, three great kings will appear, one from India and two from outside of India.🔽The three are Yavana,🔽Bhilika, and Shakunaka.

original: gsum la / ya ba na dang / balhi ka dang / sha ku na dang / 'di gsum dam pa'i chos mi spyod /
analyzed: gsum la / ya ba na dang / balhi ka dang / sha ku na dang / 'di gsum dam pa'i chos mi spyod /
translated: These three will not practice the holy Dharma.

original: dmag 'dren cing g-yul 'gyed de /
analyzed: dmag 'dren cing g-yul 'gyed de /
translated: They will lead armies and fight battles.

original: nub dang / byang gi yul khams mang po zhig 'bebs par byed de /
analyzed: nub dang / byang gi yul khams mang po zhig 'bebs par byed de /
translated: They will conquer many countries in the west and the north.

original: de nas yul khams de'i mchod rten dang / gtsug lag khang la sogs pa yang bshig cing mes bsregs te /
analyzed: de nas yul khams de'i mchod rten dang / gtsug lag khang la sogs pa yang bshig cing mes bsregs te /
translated: Then they will destroy the stupas and temples of that country and burn them with fire.

original: dge 'dun gyi yo byad dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor la sogs pa'ang brogs shing bcom ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi yo byad dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor la sogs pa'ang brogs shing bcom ste /
translated: They will plunder and destroy the property of the Sangha and the property of the Three Jewels.

original: rgyal po 'di gsum gcig la gcig gnod pa sna tshogs kyis 'thab mo byed de /
analyzed: rgyal po 'di gsum gcig la gcig gnod pa sna tshogs kyis 'thab mo byed de /
translated: These three kings will fight among themselves with various kinds of weapons.

original: gsum car gyi rgyal srid mi bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum car gyi rgyal srid mi bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The kingdom of all three will become unhappy.

original: de'i rjes la rgyal po de gsum nang srid gcig tu byas nas dmag mang po 'dus te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rgyal po de gsum nang srid gcig tu byas nas dmag mang po 'dus te /
translated: After that, the three kings will unite their countries and gather a great army.

original: rgya gar gyi yul chu bo gang g'a'i tshu rol gnad ra dang / ma ddya de sha la sogs pa'i yul phrogs nas bzung /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi yul chu bo gang g'a'i tshu rol gnad ra dang / ma ddya de sha la sogs pa'i yul phrogs nas bzung /
translated: They will plunder and seize the lands of India, such as Gandhara and Madhyadesha.

original: de'i @345a *// dus na chu bo gang g'a'i pha rol lho phyogs kyi rgyud na /
analyzed: de'i @345a *// dus na chu bo gang g'a'i pha rol lho phyogs kyi rgyud na /
translated: At that time, in the southern region beyond the Ganges River,

original: yul ko'u sh'am b'i zhes bya ba'i rgyal po ma he na dra se na zhes bya ba de la sras zhig btsas te /
analyzed: yul ko'u sh'am b'i zhes bya ba'i rgyal po ma he na dra se na zhes bya ba de la sras zhig btsas te /
translated: in the country called Kosambi, there was a king named Mahe ndradh r i ta. He had a son.

original: de'i ming ni ngu sbra sa hasta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i ming ni ngu sbra sa hasta zhes bya ste /
translated: His name was Rāhulabhadra.

original: smin mtshams na lcags kyi sme ba zhig yod pa /
analyzed: smin mtshams na lcags kyi sme ba zhig yod pa /
translated: Between his eyebrows there was an iron mole.

original: lag pa gru mo man chad khrag gis bskus pa zhig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lag pa gru mo man chad khrag gis bskus pa zhig 'byung ngo //
translated: The hands of all of them, from the elbow down, were covered with blood.

original: de dang dus gcig tu rgyal po de'i blon po lnga brgya la'ang khye'u lnga brgya btsa' ste /

analyzed: ci ste dgra bcom pa bsad ces zer te rdo rje phyung nas bsad do //
translated: “Why did you kill the arhat?” and he killed Aṅgada by striking him with the vajra.

original: de'i dus na dge slong gi rad ces bya bas mkhan po shi shya ka brdegs te bsad do //
analyzed: de'i dus na dge slong gi rad ces bya bas mkhan po shi shya ka brdegs te bsad do //
translated: At that time, a monk named Rādha killed his preceptor Śiṣyaka.

original: de nas de'i rjes la dge 'dun ril gyis 'khrugs nas gcig gis gcig bsad de gcig kyang ma lus so //
analyzed: de nas de'i rjes la dge 'dun ril gyis 'khrugs nas gcig gis gcig bsad de gcig kyang ma lus so //
translated: After that, the entire saṅgha became agitated and killed each other, leaving not a single one remaining.

original: de'i dus na nam mkha' la lha klu la sogs pa chos kyi srung ma phal po che ma dga' nas dus pa'i mchi ma ni khrag dang / me'i @348a *//🔽char bab bo //
analyzed: de'i dus na nam mkha' la lha klu la sogs pa chos kyi srung ma phal po che ma dga' nas dus pa'i mchi ma ni khrag dang / me'i @348a *// char bab bo //
translated: At that time, many of the Dharma protectors, such as the gods and nagas in the sky, were unhappy and shed tears of blood and a rain of fire.

original: nam mkha' dag ni ser dang / nag por gyur /
analyzed: nam mkha' dag ni ser dang / nag por gyur /
translated: The sky became yellow and black.

original: glog dang / sgra chen po byung /
analyzed: glog dang / sgra chen po byung /
translated: There was lightning and a great sound.

original: skar ma dh'u ma ke tu zhes bya ba lus las du ba nag po gtong ba zhig byung nas /
analyzed: skar ma dh'u ma ke tu zhes bya ba lus las du ba nag po gtong ba zhig byung nas /
translated: A star called Dhūmaketu appeared, emitting black smoke from its body.

original: des skar ma dang / zla ba la sogs pa 'od kyang med /
analyzed: des skar ma dang / zla ba la sogs pa 'od kyang med /
translated: It obscured the light of the stars, moon, and so forth.

original: gcig kyang bltar mi snang bar 'ong ngo //
analyzed: gcig kyang bltar mi snang bar 'ong ngo //
translated: Not a single one could be seen.

original: de'i dus na sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lha dang / yum m'a y'a de b'i la sogs pa 'khor phal mo che dang der 'ongs nas dge 'dun gyi gos tshon can ril gyis bsdus nas khyer bar 'ong ngo //
analyzed: de'i dus na sum cu rtsa gsum gnam gyi lha dang / yum m'a y'a de b'i la sogs pa 'khor phal mo che dang der 'ongs nas dge 'dun gyi gos tshon can ril gyis bsdus nas khyer bar 'ong ngo //
translated: At that time, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three and the retinue of the mother Māyādevī and so forth came there and collected all the colored robes of the saṅgha and took them away.

original: de'i dus na rgyal pos 'di lta bu'i ku co sgra chen po byung ba ci las gyur ces smras pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrugs nas gcig gis gcig bsad par gyur to zhes gsol pa dang / rgyal po mi dga' ste /
analyzed: de'i dus na rgyal pos 'di lta bu'i ku co sgra chen po byung ba ci las gyur ces smras pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrugs nas gcig gis gcig bsad par gyur to zhes gsol pa dang / rgyal po mi dga' ste /
translated: The king was displeased.

original: langs nas tho rangs mkhar gyi phyi rol gyi lha khang du phyin pa dang / dge 'dun la la ni mgo bcad /
analyzed: langs nas tho rangs mkhar gyi phyi rol gyi lha khang du phyin pa dang / dge 'dun la la ni mgo bcad /
translated: He got up and went to the temple outside the palace at dawn. He saw that some of the monks had their heads cut off,

original: la la ni mig phyung /
analyzed: la la ni mig phyung /
translated: some had their eyes gouged out,

original: la la ni rkang lag bcad de /
analyzed: la la ni rkang lag bcad de /
translated: some had their arms and legs cut off,

original: de ltar sna tshogs su shi ba mthong nas /
analyzed: de ltar sna tshogs su shi ba mthong nas /
translated: and so forth.🔽He searched for the bodies of the arhat and the preceptor who knew the three baskets, and when he found the bodies of both, he placed them under his right and left armpits and said, The arhat is my father,

original: dgra bcom pa dang / shi shya ka sde snod gsum shes pa'i mkhan po'i ro btsal nas gnyis ka'i ro snyed pa dang / mchan khung g-yas g-yon du bzhag nas dgra bcom pa ni nga'i pha yin; shi shya ka ni chos kyi mdzod yin /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang / shi shya ka sde snod gsum shes pa'i mkhan po'i ro btsal nas gnyis ka'i ro snyed pa dang / mchan khung g-yas g-yon du bzhag nas dgra bcom pa ni nga'i pha yin; shi shya ka ni chos kyi mdzod yin /
translated: and Śiṣyaka is the treasury of the Dharma.

original: 'di gnyis 'das par gyur pa ni da phyin cad nga'i lus dang / srog kyang gces pa med /
analyzed: 'di gnyis 'das par gyur pa ni da phyin cad nga'i lus dang / srog kyang gces pa med /
translated: Since these two have passed away, from now on I have no regard for my body or life.

original: rgyal srid kyang su 'dod pa la sbyin no zhes @348b smras pa dang / mig kyang ldongs te mi snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal srid kyang su 'dod pa la sbyin no zhes @348b smras pa dang / mig kyang ldongs te mi snang bar gyur te /
translated: He said, I will give the kingdom to anyone who wants it, and then he closed his eyes and disappeared.

original: de'i dus na blon po rnams kyis rgyal po la snying brtse ste /
analyzed: de'i dus na blon po rnams kyis rgyal po la snying brtse ste /
translated: At that time, the ministers, out of love for the king,

original: mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir mi lnga brgya bande ltar bcos te /
analyzed: mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir mi lnga brgya bande ltar bcos te /
translated: in order to dispel his sorrow, made five hundred men into monks.

original: skra dang / kha spu breg tu spu gris ma chod nas /
analyzed: skra dang / kha spu breg tu spu gris ma chod nas /
translated: When they tried to shave their hair and beards with a razor, they could not cut it.

original: skra dang / kha spu mes bsregs /
analyzed: skra dang / kha spu mes bsregs /
translated: So they burned their hair and beards with fire.

original: tshon sna brgya yang de'i che nub pas bande lnga brgya yang chos gos mi bdog nas phyugs nag po dang / dmar po'i ko ba gyon te /
analyzed: tshon sna brgya yang de'i che nub pas bande lnga brgya yang chos gos mi bdog nas phyugs nag po dang / dmar po'i ko ba gyon te /
translated: Since the hundred colors of the dye were not enough, the five hundred monks had no robes, so they put on the hides of black and red cattle.

original: bande ltar bcos nas rgyal po'i drung du 'ongs so //
analyzed: bande ltar bcos nas rgyal po'i drung du 'ongs so //
translated: Having made them into monks, they came into the king's presence.

original: blon pos rgyal po la bande lnga brgya 'ongs so zhes gsol pa dang / rgyal po dga' nas mig phye ste bande dag la brtags na /
analyzed: blon pos rgyal po la bande lnga brgya 'ongs so zhes gsol pa dang / rgyal po dga' nas mig phye ste bande dag la brtags na /
translated: The ministers said to the king, Five hundred monks have come, and the king, delighted, opened his eyes and looked at the monks.

original: bande yang ril gyis phyugs kyi pags pa gos su gyon la /
analyzed: bande yang ril gyis phyugs kyi pags pa gos su gyon la /
translated: The monks were all wearing the hides of cattle as robes.

original: skra dang / kha spu ma bregs par mes bsregs pa ni ma mthong nas rgyal po yang dga' ste /
analyzed: skra dang / kha spu ma bregs par mes bsregs pa ni ma mthong nas rgyal po yang dga' ste /
translated: He had not seen anyone with hair and a beard burned off by fire. The king was pleased.

original: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa'i yo byad 'on cig ces bsgo nas bande de rnams la mchod de /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa'i yo byad 'on cig ces bsgo nas bande de rnams la mchod de /
translated: He ordered, Bring the articles for making offerings to the Three Jewels! He made offerings to the bhikṣus.

original: bande rnams la rgyal pos zhib tu brtags na /
analyzed: bande rnams la rgyal pos zhib tu brtags na /
translated: When the king examined the bhikṣus in detail,

original: phyugs kyi pags pa chos gos su gyon la /
analyzed: phyugs kyi pags pa chos gos su gyon la /
translated: he saw that they were wearing the skins of cattle as Dharma robes.

original: skra dang / kha spu ma bregs par mes bsregs pa gsal bar mthong nas rgyal po nyid som nyi ru gyur te /
analyzed: skra dang / kha spu ma bregs par mes bsregs pa gsal bar mthong nas rgyal po nyid som nyi ru gyur te /
translated: He clearly saw that their hair and beards had been burned off by fire. The king himself became doubtful.

original: 'di dag dge slong ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag dge slong ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: He thought, These are not bhikṣus.

original: bdag gis cung zad cig dri'o snyam nas dge slong gi lta ba dang / tshul khrims gang yin zhes dris na /
analyzed: bdag gis cung zad cig dri'o snyam nas dge slong gi lta ba dang / tshul khrims gang yin zhes dris na /
translated: I will ask them a few questions. He asked, What is the view and discipline of a bhikṣu?

original: de rnams gang gis kyang dge slong gi lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs cung zad kyang mi shes @349a *//
analyzed: de rnams gang gis kyang dge slong gi lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs cung zad kyang mi shes @349a *//
translated: Since none of them knew anything about the view, discipline, or conduct of a bhikṣu,

original: pas rgyal po de la lan ma btab par cang mi smra bar 'khod pa dang / rgyal pos bsams pa /
analyzed: pas rgyal po de la lan ma btab par cang mi smra bar 'khod pa dang / rgyal pos bsams pa /
translated: they did not answer the king's question and remained silent. The king thought,

original: da ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa nub ste /
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa nub ste /
translated: Now the teaching of the Buddha has disappeared.🔽The lineage of the Three Jewels has been completely cut off.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi tshul yang dag par rgyun chad pa lta zhig snyam nas rgyal po yang mya ngan chen po langs te du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi tshul yang dag par rgyun chad pa lta zhig snyam nas rgyal po yang mya ngan chen po langs te du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The king, too, will rise up in great sorrow and weep.

original: de nas rgyal po des bande phal po che btungs te shi ba'i ro rnams blangs te bsregs nas mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po des bande phal po che btungs te shi ba'i ro rnams blangs te bsregs nas mchod pa byas te /
translated: Then the king will drink a lot of alcohol, and when he dies his corpse will be carried off and cremated, and offerings will be made.

original: de'i 'og tu rgyal po nyid kyang bstan pa nub pa'i thugs ngan gyis zhal 'tshos te 'das so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rgyal po nyid kyang bstan pa nub pa'i thugs ngan gyis zhal 'tshos te 'das so //
translated: After that, the king himself will die of grief over the disappearance of the teaching.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na 'dzam bu'i gling gi dam pa'i chos ril gyis nub ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na 'dzam bu'i gling gi dam pa'i chos ril gyis nub ste /
translated: At that time, the true Dharma of the entire world will disappear.

original: gsung rab kyi yi ge rnams kyang dung byis pa bzhin du bltar mi mngon par gyur to //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi yi ge rnams kyang dung byis pa bzhin du bltar mi mngon par gyur to //
translated: Even the letters of the scriptures will disappear, like a conch shell in the mouth of a child.

original: gser ni dngul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gser ni dngul du 'gyur ro //
translated: Gold will turn into silver.

original: dngul ni zangs dang / lcags su 'gyur ro; ;zangs dang / lcags ni rdor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngul ni zangs dang / lcags su 'gyur ro; ;zangs dang / lcags ni rdor 'gyur ro //
translated: Silver will turn into copper and iron. Copper and iron will turn into stone.

original: rin po che dang / mu tig ni rvar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rin po che dang / mu tig ni rvar 'gyur ro //
translated: Precious stones and pearls will turn into shells.

original: kha zas ni ro drug yod pa la mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva'i ro la sogs pa ni nub bo //
analyzed: kha zas ni ro drug yod pa la mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva'i ro la sogs pa ni nub bo //
translated: Food is of six kinds: sweet, sour, salty, etc.

original: kha ba dang / bska ba gnyis ni lus so //
analyzed: kha ba dang / bska ba gnyis ni lus so //
translated: The two, bitter and astringent, are bodily.🔽In the Sutra of the Questions of Arya Candragarbha,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la 'phags pa zla ba'i snying pos zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la 'phags pa zla ba'i snying pos zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: the Buddha Sakyamuni said:

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas bstan pa gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i tshul lung bstan pa'i skabs rdzogs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas bstan pa gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i tshul lung bstan pa'i skabs rdzogs so //
translated: After the nirvana of the Buddha, the period of the true Dharma will last for a thousand years, and the period of the semblance Dharma will last for a thousand years.
